title: List Creatives Response
description: Response from creative library query with filtered results, metadata, and optional enriched data

query_summary.description: Summary of the query that was executed

total_matching.description: Total number of creatives matching filters (across all pages)

returned.description: Number of creatives returned in this response

filters_applied.description: List of filters that were applied to the query

pagination.title: Pagination Response
pagination.description: Standard cursor-based pagination metadata for list responses

has_more.description: Whether more results are available beyond this page

cursor.description: Opaque cursor to pass in the next request to fetch the next page. Only present when has_more is true.

total_count.description: Total number of items matching the query across all pages. Optional because not all backends can efficiently compute this.

creatives.description: Array of creative assets matching the query

advertiser.description: The advertiser whose rates apply to this account

billing_proxy.description: Optional intermediary who receives invoices on behalf of the advertiser (e.g., agency)

status.description: Account status. pending_approval: seller reviewing (credit, contracts). rejected: seller declined the account request. payment_required: credit limit reached or funds depleted. suspended: was active, now paused. closed: was active, now terminated.

domain.description: Domain where /.well-known/brand.json is hosted, or the brand's operating domain

brand_id.title: Brand ID
brand_id.description: Brand identifier within the house portfolio. Optional for single-brand domains.

operator.description: Domain of the entity operating this account. When the brand operates directly, this is the brand's domain.

billing.description: Who is invoiced on this account. operator: seller invoices the operator (agency or brand buying direct). agent: agent consolidates billing.

rate_card.description: Identifier for the rate card applied to this account

setup.description: Present when status is 'pending_approval'. Contains next steps for completing account activation.

url.description: URL where the human can complete the required action (credit application, legal agreement, add funds).

account_scope.description: How the seller scoped this account. operator: shared across all brands for this operator. brand: shared across all operators for this brand. operator_brand: dedicated to a specific operator+brand combination. agent: the agent's default account with no brand or operator association.

sandbox.description: When true, this is a sandbox account. All requests using this account_id are treated as sandbox — no real platform calls, no real spend.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

examples.description: Direct advertiser account
Advertiser account with agency billing proxy
Agency as direct buyer
Account with brand identity and operator (via sync_accounts)
Pending account awaiting seller approval

format_id.title: Format ID
format_id.description: Format identifier specifying which format this creative conforms to

agent_url.description: URL of the agent that defines this format (e.g., 'https://creatives.adcontextprotocol.org' for standard formats, or 'https://publisher.com/.well-known/adcp/sales' for custom formats)

id.description: Format identifier within the agent's namespace (e.g., 'display_static', 'video_hosted', 'audio_standard'). When used alone, references a template format. When combined with dimension/duration fields, creates a parameterized format ID for a specific variant.

width.description: Width in pixels for visual formats. When specified, height must also be specified. Both fields together create a parameterized format ID for dimension-specific variants.

height.description: Height in pixels for visual formats. When specified, width must also be specified. Both fields together create a parameterized format ID for dimension-specific variants.

duration_ms.description: Duration in milliseconds for time-based formats (video, audio). When specified, creates a parameterized format ID. Omit to reference a template format without parameters.

status.title: Creative Status
status.description: Current approval status of the creative

enumDescriptions.processing: Creative is being processed or transcoded
enumDescriptions.approved: Creative has been approved and is ready for delivery
enumDescriptions.rejected: Creative has been rejected due to policy or technical issues
enumDescriptions.archived: Creative has been archived and is excluded from default queries

created_date.description: When the creative was uploaded to the library

updated_date.description: When the creative was last modified

catalogs.description: Catalogs this creative renders, if any

items.title: Catalog
items.description: A typed data feed. Catalogs carry the items, locations, stock levels, or pricing that publishers use to render ads. They can be synced to a platform via sync_catalogs (managed lifecycle with approval), provided inline, or fetched from an external URL. The catalog type determines the item schema and can be structural (offering, product, inventory, store, promotion) or vertical-specific (hotel, flight, job, vehicle, real_estate, education, destination, app). Selectors (ids, tags, category, query) filter items regardless of sourcing method.

catalog_id.description: Buyer's identifier for this catalog. Required when syncing via sync_catalogs. When used in creatives, references a previously synced catalog on the account.

name.description: Human-readable name for this catalog (e.g., 'Summer Products 2025', 'Amsterdam Store Locations').

type.title: Catalog Type
type.description: Catalog type. Structural types: 'offering' (AdCP Offering objects), 'product' (ecommerce entries), 'inventory' (stock per location), 'store' (physical locations), 'promotion' (deals and pricing). Vertical types: 'hotel', 'flight', 'job', 'vehicle', 'real_estate', 'education', 'destination', 'app' — each with an industry-specific item schema.

url.description: URL to an external catalog feed. The platform fetches and resolves items from this URL. For offering-type catalogs, the feed contains an array of Offering objects. For other types, the feed format is determined by feed_format. When omitted with type 'product', the platform uses its synced copy of the brand's product catalog.

feed_format.title: Feed Format
feed_format.description: Format of the external feed at url. Required when url points to a non-AdCP feed (e.g., Google Merchant Center XML, Meta Product Catalog). Omit for offering-type catalogs where the feed is native AdCP JSON.

update_frequency.title: Update Frequency
update_frequency.description: How often the platform should re-fetch the feed from url. Only applicable when url is provided. Platforms may use this as a hint for polling schedules.

items.description: Inline catalog data. The item schema depends on the catalog type: Offering objects for 'offering', StoreItem for 'store', HotelItem for 'hotel', FlightItem for 'flight', JobItem for 'job', VehicleItem for 'vehicle', RealEstateItem for 'real_estate', EducationItem for 'education', DestinationItem for 'destination', AppItem for 'app', or freeform objects for 'product', 'inventory', and 'promotion'. Mutually exclusive with url — provide one or the other, not both. Implementations should validate items against the type-specific schema.

ids.description: Filter catalog to specific item IDs. For offering-type catalogs, these are offering_id values. For product-type catalogs, these are SKU identifiers.

gtins.description: Filter product-type catalogs by GTIN identifiers for cross-retailer catalog matching. Accepts standard GTIN formats (GTIN-8, UPC-A/GTIN-12, EAN-13/GTIN-13, GTIN-14). Only applicable when type is 'product'.

tags.description: Filter catalog to items with these tags. Tags are matched using OR logic — items matching any tag are included.

category.description: Filter catalog to items in this category (e.g., 'beverages/soft-drinks', 'chef-positions').

query.description: Natural language filter for catalog items (e.g., 'all pasta sauces under $5', 'amsterdam vacancies').

conversion_events.description: Event types that represent conversions for items in this catalog. Declares what events the platform should attribute to catalog items — e.g., a job catalog converts via submit_application, a product catalog via purchase. The event's content_ids field carries the item IDs that connect back to catalog items. Use content_id_type to declare what identifier type content_ids values represent.

items.title: Event Type
items.description: Standard marketing event types for event logging, aligned with IAB ECAPI

enumDescriptions.view_content: User viewed specific content (product, article, etc.)
enumDescriptions.select_content: User selected or clicked on content (article, video, etc.)
enumDescriptions.select_item: User selected a specific product or item from a list
enumDescriptions.share: User shared content via social or messaging
enumDescriptions.add_to_cart: User added an item to cart
enumDescriptions.remove_from_cart: User removed an item from cart
enumDescriptions.add_to_wishlist: User added an item to a wishlist
enumDescriptions.refund: A purchase was fully or partially refunded (adjusts ROAS)
enumDescriptions.lead: User expressed interest (form submission, signup, etc.)
enumDescriptions.qualify_lead: Lead qualified by sales or scoring criteria
enumDescriptions.close_convert_lead: Lead converted to a customer or closed deal
enumDescriptions.disqualify_lead: Lead disqualified or marked as not viable
enumDescriptions.subscribe: User subscribed to a service or newsletter
enumDescriptions.schedule: User scheduled an appointment or event
enumDescriptions.submit_application: User submitted an application (loan, job, etc.)

content_id_type.title: Content ID Type
content_id_type.description: Identifier type that the event's content_ids field should be matched against for items in this catalog. For example, 'gtin' means content_ids values are Global Trade Item Numbers, 'sku' means retailer SKUs. Omit when using a custom identifier scheme not listed in the enum.

feed_field_mappings.description: Declarative normalization rules for external feeds. Maps non-standard feed field names, date formats, price encodings, and image URLs to the AdCP catalog item schema. Applied during sync_catalogs ingestion. Supports field renames, named transforms (date, divide, boolean, split), static literal injection, and assignment of image URLs to typed asset pools.

items.title: Catalog Field Mapping
items.description: Declares how a field in an external feed maps to the AdCP catalog item schema. Used in sync_catalogs feed_field_mappings to normalize non-AdCP feeds (Google Merchant Center, LinkedIn Jobs XML, hotel XML, etc.) to the standard catalog item schema without requiring the buyer to preprocess every feed. Multiple mappings can assemble a nested object via dot notation (e.g., separate mappings for price.amount and price.currency).

feed_field.description: Field name in the external feed record. Omit when injecting a static literal value (use the value property instead).

catalog_field.description: Target field on the catalog item schema, using dot notation for nested fields (e.g., 'name', 'price.amount', 'location.city'). Mutually exclusive with asset_group_id.

asset_group_id.description: Places the feed field value (a URL) into a typed asset pool on the catalog item's assets array. The value is wrapped as an image or video asset in a group with this ID. Use standard group IDs: 'images_landscape', 'images_vertical', 'images_square', 'logo', 'video'. Mutually exclusive with catalog_field.

value.description: Static literal value to inject into catalog_field for every item, regardless of what the feed contains. Mutually exclusive with feed_field. Useful for fields the feed omits (e.g., currency when price is always USD, or a constant category value).

transform.description: Named transform to apply to the feed field value before writing to the catalog schema. See transform-specific parameters (format, timezone, by, separator).

format.description: For transform 'date': the input date format string (e.g., 'YYYYMMDD', 'MM/DD/YYYY', 'DD-MM-YYYY'). Output is always ISO 8601 (e.g., '2025-03-01'). Uses Unicode date pattern tokens.

timezone.description: For transform 'date': the timezone of the input value. IANA timezone identifier (e.g., 'UTC', 'America/New_York', 'Europe/Amsterdam'). Defaults to UTC when omitted.

by.description: For transform 'divide': the divisor to apply (e.g., 100 to convert integer cents to decimal dollars).

separator.description: For transform 'split': the separator character or string to split on. Defaults to ','.

default.description: Fallback value to use when feed_field is absent, null, or empty. Applied after any transform would have been applied. Allows optional feed fields to have a guaranteed baseline value.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

examples.description: Simple field rename
Date format transform — YYYYMMDD to ISO 8601
Divide cents to dollars
Static literal injection — currency not in feed
Image URL assigned to typed asset pool
Vertical photo URL assigned to vertical pool
Split comma-separated tags to array
Boolean coercion with default
Synced product catalog from Google Merchant Center
Inventory feed for store-level stock data
Store locator feed
Promotional pricing feed
Inline offering catalog (no sync needed)
Reference to a previously synced catalog by ID
Product catalog with GTIN cross-retailer matching and attribution
Inline store catalog with catchment areas

assets.description: Assets for this creative, keyed by asset_role

oneOf.title: Image Asset
oneOf.description: Image asset with URL and dimensions

format.description: Image file format (jpg, png, gif, webp, etc.)

oneOf.title: Video Asset
oneOf.description: Video asset with URL and technical specifications including audio track properties

container_format.description: Video container format (mp4, webm, mov, etc.)

video_codec.description: Video codec used (h264, h265, vp9, av1, prores, etc.)

video_bitrate_kbps.description: Video stream bitrate in kilobits per second

frame_rate.description: Frame rate as string to preserve precision (e.g., '23.976', '29.97', '30')

frame_rate_type.description: Whether the video uses constant (CFR) or variable (VFR) frame rate

hdr_format.description: HDR format if applicable, or 'sdr' for standard dynamic range

moov_atom_position.description: Position of moov atom in MP4 container

has_audio.description: Whether the video contains an audio track

audio_codec.description: Audio codec used (aac, aac_lc, he_aac, pcm, mp3, ac3, eac3, etc.)

audio_bitrate_kbps.description: Audio bitrate in kilobits per second

captions_url.description: URL to captions file (WebVTT, SRT, etc.)

transcript_url.description: URL to text transcript of the video content

audio_description_url.description: URL to audio description track for visually impaired users

oneOf.title: Audio Asset
oneOf.description: Audio asset with URL and technical specifications

container_format.description: Audio container/file format (mp3, m4a, aac, wav, ogg, flac, etc.)

codec.description: Audio codec used (aac, aac_lc, he_aac, pcm, mp3, vorbis, opus, flac, ac3, eac3, etc.)

transcript_url.description: URL to text transcript of the audio content

accessibility.description: Self-declared accessibility properties for this opaque creative

alt_text.description: Text alternative describing the creative content

keyboard_navigable.description: Whether the creative can be fully operated via keyboard

motion_control.description: Whether the creative respects prefers-reduced-motion or provides pause/stop controls

screen_reader_tested.description: Whether the creative has been tested with screen readers

accessibility.description: Self-declared accessibility properties for this opaque creative

alt_text.description: Text alternative describing the creative content

keyboard_navigable.description: Whether the creative can be fully operated via keyboard

motion_control.description: Whether the creative respects prefers-reduced-motion or provides pause/stop controls

screen_reader_tested.description: Whether the creative has been tested with screen readers

oneOf.title: VAST Asset
oneOf.description: VAST (Video Ad Serving Template) tag for third-party video ad serving

delivery_type.description: Discriminator indicating VAST is delivered via URL endpoint

url.description: URL endpoint that returns VAST XML

vpaid_enabled.description: Whether VPAID (Video Player-Ad Interface Definition) is supported

duration_ms.description: Expected video duration in milliseconds (if known)

items.title: VAST Tracking Event
items.description: Standard VAST tracking events for video ad playback and interaction

tracking_events.description: Tracking events supported by this VAST tag

captions_url.description: URL to captions file (WebVTT, SRT, etc.)

audio_description_url.description: URL to audio description track for visually impaired users

delivery_type.description: Discriminator indicating VAST is delivered as inline XML content

vpaid_enabled.description: Whether VPAID (Video Player-Ad Interface Definition) is supported

duration_ms.description: Expected video duration in milliseconds (if known)

items.title: VAST Tracking Event
items.description: Standard VAST tracking events for video ad playback and interaction

tracking_events.description: Tracking events supported by this VAST tag

captions_url.description: URL to captions file (WebVTT, SRT, etc.)

audio_description_url.description: URL to audio description track for visually impaired users

oneOf.title: DAAST Asset
oneOf.description: DAAST (Digital Audio Ad Serving Template) tag for third-party audio ad serving

delivery_type.description: Discriminator indicating DAAST is delivered via URL endpoint

url.description: URL endpoint that returns DAAST XML

duration_ms.description: Expected audio duration in milliseconds (if known)

items.title: DAAST Tracking Event
items.description: Standard DAAST tracking events for audio ad playback and interaction

tracking_events.description: Tracking events supported by this DAAST tag

companion_ads.description: Whether companion display ads are included

transcript_url.description: URL to text transcript of the audio content

delivery_type.description: Discriminator indicating DAAST is delivered as inline XML content

duration_ms.description: Expected audio duration in milliseconds (if known)

items.title: DAAST Tracking Event
items.description: Standard DAAST tracking events for audio ad playback and interaction

tracking_events.description: Tracking events supported by this DAAST tag

companion_ads.description: Whether companion display ads are included

transcript_url.description: URL to text transcript of the audio content

url_type.title: URL Asset Type
url_type.description: Type of URL asset: 'clickthrough' for user click destination (landing page), 'tracker_pixel' for impression/event tracking via HTTP request (fires GET, expects pixel/204 response), 'tracker_script' for measurement SDKs that must load as <script> tag (OMID verification, native event trackers using method:2)

description.description: Description of what this URL points to

tags.description: User-defined tags for organization and searchability

assignment_count.description: Total number of active package assignments

assigned_packages.description: List of packages this creative is assigned to

buyer_ref.description: Buyer's reference identifier for this package

last_updated.description: When performance data was last updated

sub_assets.description: Sub-assets for multi-asset formats (included when include_sub_assets=true)

items.title: Sub-Asset
items.description: Sub-asset for multi-asset creative formats, including carousel images and native ad template variables

asset_kind.description: Discriminator indicating this is a media asset with content_uri

asset_type.description: Type of asset. Common types: thumbnail_image, product_image, featured_image, logo

asset_id.description: Unique identifier for the asset within the creative

content_uri.description: URL for media assets (images, videos, etc.)

asset_kind.description: Discriminator indicating this is a text asset with content

asset_type.description: Type of asset. Common types: headline, body_text, cta_text, price_text, sponsor_name, author_name, click_url

asset_id.description: Unique identifier for the asset within the creative

oneOf.description: Multiple text content values (for A/B testing or variations)

content.description: Text content for text-based assets like headlines, body text, CTA text, etc.

format_summary.description: Breakdown of creatives by format type

^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$.description: Number of creatives with this format

sandbox.description: When true, this response contains simulated data from sandbox mode.

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

examples.description: Successful library query with results
Query with assignments and performance data

_bundled.note: This is a bundled schema with all $ref resolved inline. For the modular version with references, use the parent directory.
